Onix Plugin Documentation
Table of Contents

Class SvgRenderer

Namespace
OnixRuntime.Api.Rendering.Helpers
Assembly
OnixRuntime.dll

Helper class to render svg documents at varying sizes.

public class SvgRenderer
Inheritance
object
SvgRenderer
Inherited Members

object.Equals(object, object)

object.GetType()
object.MemberwiseClone()
object.ReferenceEquals(object, object)
object.ToString()

Properties

DisplayTimeBeforeGeneration

How long a size that falls within the regeneration threshold should be shown before we generate a specialized image for it. This is used to avoid generating images for sizes that are only shown for a short time while still allowing for images to be generated for sizes that are shown for a longer time.

public float DisplayTimeBeforeGeneration { get; set; }

Property Value

float

Document

Gets the SVG document that is used for rendering, measuring, whatever. This will return null when the document is not yet loaded. You can check this periodically if you need to document to be loaded before things happen. Please don't use this to avoid rendering when not ready, this is handled for you.

public SvgDocument? Document { get; }

Property Value

SvgDocument

The loaded SVG document, or null if not yet loaded.

NoShowThreshold

How long in seconds between renders should we assume that the image wasn't shown for a while. This will reset how long it's been on screen and delay its generation.

public float NoShowThreshold { get; set; }

Property Value

float

PathProvider

This function is used to get a virtual TexturePath for the SVG image rendering at a specific size. The default implementation constructs a path based on the renderer's base path and file name, appending the size in the format "{width}x{height}.png". If you need a different path structure or want to use a different method to get the texture path, you can override this function. It will upload the image for that size under whatever TexturePath you return here.

public Func<SvgRenderer, Vec2I, TexturePath> PathProvider { get; set; }

Property Value

Func<SvgRenderer, Vec2I, TexturePath>

RegenerationThreshold

When rendering in non-static mode, this is the minimum size difference that will trigger a regeneration of the SVG image. This is used to avoid regenerating the image too often when the size changes too slightly. /// The default value is 64x64 pixels, meaning that the image will only be regenerated if the size changes by at least 64 pixels in either dimension. This is useful to avoid unnecessary rendering when the size changes slightly, but you can adjust it to your needs. This is to avoid animations generating a ton of images when the size changes slightly. When rendering an image at the same size for a while, a new image will only be generated regardless of this treshold.

public Vec2I RegenerationThreshold { get; set; }

Property Value

Vec2I

RenderClosestSizeUntilReady

This is used to determine if the SVG renderer should render the closest size available until the texture of the proper size is ready.

public bool RenderClosestSizeUntilReady { get; set; }

Property Value

bool

SizeTransformer

This function transforms the size given by the user when rendering the image into the size of the actual image data. The default implementation multiplies the size by the GUI scale factor, making it the same raw pixel size as the GUI. If you want to use the SVG renderer for other purposes, you can override this function to return a different size fitting your needs.

public Func<SvgRenderer, Vec2, Vec2I> SizeTransformer { get; set; }

Property Value

Func<SvgRenderer, Vec2, Vec2I>

SvgImageRenderer

This function is used to render the SVG document into a raw image data. The default implementation uses the SvgDocument's Render method to create a RawImageData object. This will fill the whole image, stretching it if necessary. If you need more control over how it places the SVG into the image, you can override this function.

public Func<SvgRenderer, Vec2I, SvgDocument, RawImageData> SvgImageRenderer { get; set; }

Property Value

Func<SvgRenderer, Vec2I, SvgDocument, RawImageData>

VirtualBasePath

This is the virtual base path used to identify the SVG image. It is used to construct the texture path for the SVG image. This allows you to group SVG images under a common path in the texture cache.

public string VirtualBasePath { get; set; }

Property Value

string

VirtualFileName

This is the virtual file name used to identify the SVG image. These things need a name, so we can upload them to the texture cache. The name should be unique for each SVG image, and it will be used to construct the texture path.

public string VirtualFileName { get; set; }

Property Value

string

Methods

Create(string, SvgDocument)

Creates a new SVG renderer from an already loaded SVG document.

public static SvgRenderer Create(string virtualFileName, SvgDocument document)

Parameters

virtualFileName string

The virtual file name to use for identifying this SVG in the texture cache.

document SvgDocument

The loaded SVG document.

Returns

SvgRenderer

A new SvgRenderer instance.

Creates a new SVG renderer from the provided SVG document content.

public static SvgRenderer Create(string virtualFileName, string documentContent)

Parameters

The virtual file name to use for identifying this SVG in the texture cache.

documentContent string

The SVG document content as a string.

Returns

A new SvgRenderer instance.

Creates a new SVG renderer that will load the SVG document from the specified file path.

public static SvgRenderer CreateFromFile(string documentPath)

Parameters

The file path to the SVG document.

Returns

SvgRenderer

A new SvgRenderer instance.

RenderDynamic(RendererCommon, Rect, ColorF)

Renders the SVG in dynamic mode at the specified position with the given color tint. Dynamic mode uses intelligent caching and may render approximate sizes until the exact size is ready.

public bool RenderDynamic(RendererCommon gfx, Rect position, ColorF tint)

Parameters

gfx RendererCommon

The graphics renderer to use.

position Rect

The position and size to render at.

tint ColorF

The color tint to apply.

Returns

bool

True if the SVG was rendered, false if it's not ready yet.

RenderDynamic(RendererCommon, Rect, ColorF, Rect)

Renders the SVG in dynamic mode at the specified position with the given color tint and UV coordinates. Dynamic mode uses intelligent caching and may render approximate sizes until the exact size is ready.

public bool RenderDynamic(RendererCommon gfx, Rect position, ColorF tint, Rect uv)

Parameters

gfx RendererCommon

The graphics renderer to use.

position Rect

The position and size to render at.

tint ColorF

The color tint to apply.

uv Rect

The UV coordinates for texture sampling.

Returns

bool

True if the SVG was rendered, false if it's not ready yet.

RenderDynamic(RendererCommon, Rect, float)

Renders the SVG in dynamic mode at the specified position with the given opacity. Dynamic mode uses intelligent caching and may render approximate sizes until the exact size is ready.

public bool RenderDynamic(RendererCommon gfx, Rect position, float opacity = 1)

Parameters

gfx RendererCommon

The graphics renderer to use.

position Rect

The position and size to render at.

opacity float

The opacity to render with (0.0 to 1.0).

Returns

bool

True if the SVG was rendered, false if it's not ready yet.

RenderDynamic(RendererCommon, Rect, float, Rect)

Renders the SVG in dynamic mode at the specified position with the given opacity and UV coordinates. Dynamic mode uses intelligent caching and may render approximate sizes until the exact size is ready.

public bool RenderDynamic(RendererCommon gfx, Rect position, float opacity, Rect uv)

Parameters

gfx RendererCommon

The graphics renderer to use.

position Rect

The position and size to render at.

opacity float

The opacity to render with (0.0 to 1.0).

uv Rect

The UV coordinates for texture sampling.

Returns

bool

True if the SVG was rendered, false if it's not ready yet.

RenderStatic(RendererCommon, Rect, ColorF)

Renders the SVG in static mode at the specified position with the given color tint. Static mode always generates the perfect size for the render position.

public bool RenderStatic(RendererCommon gfx, Rect position, ColorF tint)

Parameters

gfx RendererCommon

The graphics renderer to use.

position Rect

The position and size to render at.

tint ColorF

The color tint to apply.

Returns

bool

True if the SVG was rendered, false if it's not ready yet.
